Environment.Name: Long Hallway, South End
Environment.Description: The door opens into what appears to be a really long hallway continuing North. There's no light at the other end.

Map.Name: Origin
Map.Description: A moment ago you were just in bed floating above your mind, dreaming about how to add zebras to spreadsheets.  Now it appears you've awakened in a dimlit room. Many unfamiliar smells lurk around you.

Fields.Name: Key
Fields.Description: in a pile of debris and trash

Fields: After a few minutes of getting the key to fit correctly, the lock releases and the door creakily opens.

Map.Name: Long Hallway, South End
Map.Description: The door opens into what appears to be a really long hallway continuing North. There's no light at the other end.

Map.Name: Long Hallway, North End
Map.Description: It gets so dark you have to feel your way around. Thankfully there's nothing too dangerous in your path.

Exits.Description: The south end of the hallway
A door with no features, labeled 'Private'

Map.Name: Office
Map.Description: As the door opens, you begin to see the remnants of an old dusty office.  This place hasn't been used in years. An old typewriter on the desk is missing most of its keys.

Fields: As you press down hard on one of the keys. The air begins to move around you. Suddenly, a secret passage opens up from within the wall.

Map.Name: Secret Passage
Map.Description:
The path leads downward with considerable gradient. Things turn cold as you hear a voice... 'stoi impul chani, mario.' Frozen, but unable to make out any figures ahead of you, you shout back 'Who's there?'
A few seconds pass, finally a response... 'die!'.  As you fall backward you stumble over a rock.

Fields: You throw the rock directly at the voice and hear a terrible scream.  Moments later you can hear footsteps running to the east away from you.

Map.Name: Dark Passage
Map.Description: Is it really a good idea to go chasing after such a terrible, unknown, thing? Probably not, but that hasn't stopped you so far.

Fields.Name: Gold
Fields.Description: that probably fell out of someones pocket
